dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So, Tair Nazkhanov and Azamat Sadvakassov, those lawyers, they really emphasize staying polite if you're stopped by police in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Tair Nazkhanov and Azamat Sadvakassov, those lawyers, they really emphasize staying polite if you're stopped by police in Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Therefore, my colleague Mr Abzal Kassymzhanov and I prepared some key instructions on how to act when stopped by the Kazakhstan police officers and protect your legal rights. Tair Nazkhanov, Attorney, LLM Abzal Kassymzhanov, Attorney, LLM

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they say it can prevent tense relations, which is huge for avoiding a culture shock, especially for foreigners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they say it can prevent tense relations, which is huge for avoiding a culture shock, especially for foreigners.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Be polite. This may prevent you from having tense relations with the police. We believe the instructions might be helpful and interesting for foreigners so that they do not experience a huge culture shock in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but they also mention, um, if you think you're about to be detained, you should ask the officers to show their official ID and introduce themselves.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but they also mention, um, if you think you're about to be detained, you should ask the officers to show their official I D and introduce themselves.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In case you know the reason you are being stopped and you clearly understand the police is going to execute an administrative offense protocol and you are about to be detained by the police, please ask the police officers to show you their official ID and introduce them to you.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And write down those details! That's such a practical step—it's not just about being cooperative, it's about documenting everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And write down those details! That's such a practical step-it's not just about being cooperative, it's about documenting everything.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And they stress not to resist, even if you suspect misconduct, because you can address it later in court.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And they stress not to resist, even if you suspect misconduct, because you can address it later in court.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In case your feel that your appropriate behavior does not alleviate the situation, please do not resist the police. There might be misconduct by the police and you can prove it later on.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is where the administrative detention protocol comes in—like specifying that you need an attorney or an interpreter if you don't speak the language.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is where the administrative detention protocol comes in-like specifying that you need an attorney or an interpreter if you don't speak the language.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Here is a list of key violations you should specify clearly in the administrative detention protocol. Please do not simply tell the police about them, but rather specify them all in writing: specify that you need an attorney; specify that you need an interpreter, in case you do not speak the language the protocol is prepared in;

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, and if the protocol's in Russian but you only speak Kazakh, or vice versa, you have to request it in your language.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, and if the protocol's in Russian but you only speak Kazakh, or vice versa, you have to request it in your language.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: specify that you need the protocol in Kazakh, in case you do not speak Russian or vice versa;

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And if the police don't explain your rights? You gotta note that down in writing too. It's all about creating a paper trail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And if the police don't explain your rights? You gotta note that down in writing too. It's all about creating a paper trail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ask the police to explain your rights to you. In case the police fail to do so, please specify that in the protocol;

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which you can then take to an administrative court, even file objections online using E-gov keys before the hearing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which you can then take to an administrative court, even file objections online using E-gov keys before the hearing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: You can file your objections to the judge online using E-gov keys before the court hearing, or alternatively, you may submit your objections during the court hearing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's smart—proactive instead of reactive. But honestly, it sounds like you really have to keep your cool under pressure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's smart-proactive instead of reactive. But honestly, it sounds like you really have to keep your cool under pressure.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Your behavior can either help you or cause problems, so knowing these steps is key to protecting your rights there.

HostB: And write down those details! That's such a practical step—it’s not just about being cooperative, it’s about documenting everything.
HostA: Exactly. And they stress not to resist, even if you suspect misconduct, because you can address it later in court.
HostB: Which is where the administrative detention protocol comes in—like specifying that you need an attorney or an interpreter if you don’t speak the language.
HostA: Oh yeah, and if the protocol’s in Russian but you only speak Kazakh, or vice versa, you have to request it in your language.
HostB: And if the police don’t explain your rights? You gotta note that down in writing too. It’s all about creating a paper trail.
HostA: Which you can then take to an administrative court, even file objections online using E-gov keys before the hearing.
HostB: It’s smart—proactive instead of reactive. But honestly, it sounds like you really have to keep your cool under pressure.
HostA: For sure. Your behavior can either help you or cause problems, so knowing these steps is key to protecting your rights there.
